articles.description: Christian Horner says it is "time to draw a line under" the controversy over accusations about his behaviour towards a female employee.

articles.description: England already face an uphill battle to salvage a final win from their tour of India after an awful batting collapse on day one of the fifth Test in Dharamsala.
articles.title: England collapse gives India control of final Test

articles.description: England flew out to India as unfancied underdogs, but, against a backdrop of assassination and unrest, cliched a comeback series win.
articles.title: Death, disaster and redemption - England's tumultuous tour of India

articles.description: Sweden midfielder Kristoffer Olsson is suffering from several small blood clots on both sides of his brain, say his club Midtjylland.
articles.title: Sweden's Olsson suffering from blood clots on brain

articles.description: Ireland head coach Andy Farrell says he does not pay attention to England's critics and insists they are an "unbelievably dangerous" team as they prepare to meet in Saturday's Six Nations game.
articles.title: England are 'unbelievably dangerous' - Farrell

articles.description: Anthony Joshua looks "back to his best" after three wins from three fights in 2023 - but how did he re-find his confidence?
articles.title: 'Confident, powerful, sharp' - how Joshua got back to his best

articles.description: Scotland make three changes against Italy in the Six Nations with Cameron Redpath, George Horne and Andy Christie starting.
